Position.Title: Evaluation Practice Coordinator
Position.BriefRoleStatement: Providing high quality advice and support on key strategic issues and projects focusing on government priorities and directions and the stages of learning K-12. Providing expertise in program evaluation and data analysis.
Position.StatementOfDuties:
• Contributing to the professional growth of staff in areas of project management, evaluation advice and practice.
  • Developing, managing, monitoring and evaluating key policies, projects and initiatives K-12.
  • Ensuring that advice given and initiatives planned are informed by current educational research and national and international best practice
  • Ensuring that advice given and initiatives planned are informed by current evaluation practice.
  • Liaising and communicating with key stakeholders, other directorates, networks and schools on projects, strategies and policies K-12.
  • Preparing correspondence, reports, research papers and briefings on policy and strategic issues K-12.
  • Providing policy and practice advice on program and project management and evaluation planning and execution.

SelectionCriteria.Criteria: Teaching qualifications and successful school based experience within the K-12 range
Demonstrated understanding of the professional standards and accreditation processes and capacity to coordinate accreditation processes with staff
Excellent liaison, negotiation, conflict resolution and team building skills across a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrated outstanding written and oral communication and interpersonal skills and the capacity to apply these to a wide range of reports, submissions and strategic planning
Demonstrated high level capacity to initiate, develop, evaluate and coordinate planning, monitoring and reporting practices to drive improvement
High level ability to manage multiple commitments within tight timeframes in a complex and politically sensitive environment
Proven ability to plan, implement, manage, monitor and evaluate educational programs, provisions and resources
In-depth knowledge and understanding of Departmental and whole of Government issues, policy direction, objectives and service delivery functions
Capacity to lead staff in implementing the Department's Aboriginal Education and Training policies to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people
